title: A Dataset for Automatic Assessment of TTS Quality in Spanish
author: Alejandro Sosa Welford (Ingeniería de Sonido, Universidad Nacional de Tres de Febrero), Leonardo Pepino (Departamento de Computación, Universidad de Buenos Aires), ...
relevance_why: The development of a dataset for assessing TTS systems in Spanish aligns with the focus on speech technologies in Haohe Liu's work, especially in improving automated quality assessments in audio production.
background: Creating a dataset to evaluate the naturalness of text-to-speech systems in Spanish using subjective ratings as a reference.
contribution: This paper introduces a comprehensive dataset and evaluation methodology to assess TTS quality, achieving a mean absolute error of 0.8 on a five-point mean opinion score scale.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Most existing TTS quality assessments focus on English or Mandarin and rely heavily on human evaluations without automated alternatives.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work provides a first-of-its-kind Spanish dataset and models specifically fine-tuned for evaluating TTS naturalness, greatly enhancing the practicality of TTS evaluations.

key_innovation: The unique combination of TTS systems and human voice samples in a well-structured dataset promotes the establishment of automated assessments tailored for Spanish.
real_world_impact: This dataset could significantly improve the development of Spanish TTS systems, impacting applications in accessibility, voice assistants, and content production.
limitations: The models show bias towards predicting the mean MOS score and struggle with scores around 4 due to a lack of representation.

new_terms.mean opinion score (MOS): **Mean Opinion Score (MOS)** is a metric used to evaluate the perceived quality of synthesized speech, typically rated on a scale from 1 (poor) to 5 (excellent).
new_terms.vocoders: **Vocoders** are signal processing techniques that synthesize human speech or other sounds by modulating a carrier signal based on the audio input.

open_sourcing: The dataset and source codes were made publicly available.
